intro: Bupleurum apiculatum var. albicans, commonly known as the white-flowered bupleurum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that contribute to its ornamental appeal. This variant is distinguished by its pale floral coloration, setting it apart from other varieties within the Bupleurum genus.
